subject: Web3
title: Multisig Wallets
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Multisig Wallets.

hook.text: A multisig wallet requires multiple people to approve a transaction. It's a digital version of dual-key security.

buildup.text: Many DAOs use multisigs for treasury management. A common setup is 4-of-7: four out of seven signers must approve.

discovery.text: Gnosis Safe became the standard multisig tool. It secures over $100 billion across thousands of DAOs.

twist.text: Multisigs aren't truly decentralized. The signing group is a small committee â€” a point of trust in a trustless system.

climax.text: Multisigs balance security with practicality. Full on-chain governance is ideal; multisigs are what actually works.

punchline.text: Seven keys, four needed. Trust distributed, not eliminated.

quiz.question: How does a 4-of-7 multisig wallet work?
options: Four of seven signers must approve each transaction
